main event: The document contains multiple UFO sightings and celestial observations from June 1958, including reports of bright stars, planetary positions, and constellations.
interesting points: The sightings include observations of bright stars like Jupiter, Saturn, and the stars in various constellations, as well as descriptions of their celestial positions.

The report also features information about astronomical events such as the full moon, moon passing Saturn, moon in last quarter, Saturn opposition and nearest to earth distance, and other significant celestial occurrences during June 1958.
One of the sightings involves a pilot reporting a glaring light that disintegrated into three parts while flying from Shannon, Ireland, to New York City.
Descriptions of various constellations visible in the June sky, including notable stars, planets, and their celestial movements are provided in the report.
The document also mentions the significance of the summer solstice and the position of the sun during this astronomical event.
result: The UFO report includes multiple observations of celestial phenomena and unidentified flying objects, providing detailed accounts of various sightings and astronomical events.
sighted object: bright stars, planets, constellations, and unidentified flying objects
location: various locations across the United States and international destinations
witnesses: pilots, civilians, amateur astronomers, and military personnel
photographs: no photographs included, only textual descriptions and celestial charts
